items.sentence: There\'s a black SUV parked in front of Tom\'s house.
Tom was sentenced to probation and community service.
Tom was wearing a cowboy hat the last time I saw him.
You should look over the contract before you sign it.
Tom and Mary agreed to postpone the party for a week.
Compare your sentence with the one on the blackboard.
How much would you charge me to do my laundry for me?
I wonder where to hang this picture that Tom gave me.
Tom is probably just a year or two younger than Mary.
Tom is probably more interested in Mary than you are.
Tom is reading a book about the history of Australia.
Tom is slowly catching up with the rest of the class.
Tom is still looking out the window waiting for Mary.
It may not be necessary for us to go to that meeting.
The old man narrowly escaped being run over by a car.
I took advantage of a sale and bought three sweaters.
I want to get a good seat, so I plan to arrive early.
I want to stop this rumor before it goes any further.
I thought you didn\'t want to talk about this matter.
I thought you were going to talk about this with Tom.
Tom tried to restart the car, but it wouldn\'t start.
Tom noticed that Mary wasn\'t wearing a wedding ring.
Tom only plays the bagpipes when Mary isn\'t at home.
Do they have bike lanes on the freeways in Australia?
For a moment, it looked as if Tom might start crying.
A man as old as Tom doesn\'t make new friends easily.
Why would Tom want to do that if he doesn\'t have to?
Why would you want to go there if you don\'t have to?
We\'re sorry, but we can\'t do anything more for you.
Tom doesn\'t like to be kept waiting for a long time.
Tom didn\'t feel comfortable driving Mary\'s new car.
I never realized how awful living all alone could be.
I don\'t believe in paying for services I don\'t use.
You\'re going to tell Tom what happened, aren\'t you?
What makes Tom so sure that this won\'t happen again?
The town where I grew up didn\'t have parking meters.
I feel exactly the same way as you do about all this.
Why didn\'t you tell me you knew how to speak French?
I went to Australia, but I didn\'t see any kangaroos.
It doesn\'t make any difference to me what you think.
It pains me to have to say this, but it\'s the truth.
Tom certainly doesn\'t seem to know what he\'s doing.
Our plane landed in Boston just before the storm hit.
It may not have been as difficult as Tom said it was.
It seems to me that she has a tendency to exaggerate.
It took Tom a long time to decide who should do that.
Tom was walking in the park with nothing on his mind.
Tom said that he didn\'t have the courage to do that.
Tom says he knows Mary can\'t speak French very well.
Tom says it\'s important for us to be there tomorrow.
Tom pretended that he didn\'t know what was going on.
I thought I had the right to fire anyone I wanted to.
I was away from home all through the summer vacation.
It\'s possible Tom doesn\'t have a driver\'s license.
Tom said he had eaten nothing, but that wasn\'t true.
I\'ll do whatever it takes to get the results I want.
I\'m sure Tom is going to be tired when he gets home.
I\'ve already done everything Tom has asked me to do.
If Tom didn\'t come here by bus, how did he get here?
Tom finished his chores and then he did his homework.
Tom got a decent grade on the test he took last week.
Tom says that he\'d like to come over this afternoon.
Tom says that he\'s sorry that he caused you trouble.
Tom says that he\'s willing to make you one for free.
I don\'t know whether he\'s a college student or not.
I make it a rule never to ask a woman how old she is.
I think that Tom sounds like a native French speaker.
They wanted much more than we were able to give them.
Tom wrote Mary a letter and thanked her for her help.
Tom wrote a lot of letters to Mary while he was away.
Was your name on the list of names I gave you before?
There\'s nothing more important to me than my family.
I never realized how much Tom wanted to go to Boston.
Tom drank a few cups of coffee to keep himself awake.
Tom dropped out of college and became a truck driver.
Tom ended up getting paid much less than he expected.
I hope they throw Tom in jail and throw away the key.
I can\'t stand the thought of losing Tom as a friend.
I didn\'t have any trouble convincing Tom to do that.
I didn\'t have any trouble convincing Tom to help us.
She asked him to come into her house, but he refused.
Tom doesn\'t need to do anything he doesn\'t want to.
It looks like you\'re quicker at doing that than Tom.
It\'s clear Tom and Mary want to spend time together.
Tom probably thinks that what he\'s doing is helping.
Tom made me swear not to tell Mary about what he did.
I\'ve already delivered the packages to Tom\'s house.
Tom doesn\'t know whether Mary will ever forgive him.
Tom told me he didn\'t actually want to go to Boston.
Tom told me that I didn\'t have to be there tomorrow.
Mary noticed that Tom hadn\'t shaved in several days.
How did you support yourself before you got this job?
How do you know if your child is ready for preschool?
How do you think Tom will convince Mary to marry him?
How long did it take for you to convince Tom to help?
How long did you think the meeting was going to last?
You might want to have someone look into that matter.
Tom didn\'t like children then and he still doesn\'t.
Tom is convinced that Mary won\'t be able to do that.
Tom doesn\'t know if he should accept the job or not.
